head.supplied: 14/2/89 ¶ ¶ Herewith, dear Dr Bride, a few more medals, to be added to those in the library. ¶ The two Royal Medals, (Gold and Silver) I like to keep along with the Decorations from Sovereigns, til ...

div.p: VPRS 805/P000O/141/89-190, outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Herewith, dear Dr Bride, a few more medals, to be added to those in the library.
MS annotation: 'To Miss Cane 14.2.89. List of medals. Philadelphia, 1876. Adelaide Jubilee 1887. Melbourne & Sydney Royal Commissions 1879-81. Hawain (sic) Agricultural Society, 1882. Kützung, F. T.' Miss Cane not identified. The two Royal Medals, (Gold and Silver) I like to keep along with the Decorations from Sovereigns, til the remaining bid
bit? of my earthly career will have come to an end. You will have received the two last volumes of Prof Saccardo's Sylloge fungorum.
Saccardo (1882-1931). Probably vol. 7, parts 1 and 2, published March and October 1888, respectively (TL2). It is a very important and also very costly work. I am thankful, that you now send out the "Select plants" (7th Edition) and Key I & II.
B88.12.01, B88.11.02 and B86.04.05 respectively. See M to T. Bride, 14 January 1889. Both are eagerly expected abroad.
